original_title: Sri Lanka’s Cargills Bank plans IPO
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Cargills Bank announced an initial public offering of ordinary voting shares.
The Bank proposes to issue 62,500,000 ordinary voting shares at a price of 8.00 rupees a share.

“We are pleased to announce that in-principle approval has been granted by the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) for the listing of the ordinary voting shares of Cargills Bank Limited by way of offer for subscription on the main board,” the company said in a statement.
The company is an associate company of C T Holdings Plc. (Colombo/Dec1/2023)
